headline: Edison Intl (EIX) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Today, Edison International reported third quarter core earnings per share of $2.34 compared to $1.51 a year ago.  This comparison is not meaningful because during the quarter, SCE recorded a true-up for the 2025 general rate case final decision, which is retroactive to January 1.  Reflecting the year-to-date performance and our outlook for the remainder of the year, including the costs for potential early refinancing activities later this year, we are narrowing our 2025 core EPS guidance range to $5.95 to $6.20 and are reaffirming our 5% to 7% core EPS growth target.

Reflecting the year-to-date performance and our outlook for the remainder of the year, including the costs for potential early refinancing activities later this year, we are narrowing our 2025 core EPS guidance range to $5.95 to $6.20 and are reaffirming our 5% to 7% core EPS growth target.

headline: Edison International (EIX) Q3 Earnings and Revenues Beat Estimates
summary: Edison International (EIX) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +8.33% and +2.58%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Edison International: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: ROSEMEAD, Calif. AP) — Edison International (EIX) on Tuesday reported third-quarter earnings of $888 million. On a per-share basis, the Rosemead, California-based company said it had net income of $2.16.

headline: Edison International Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
summary: ROSEMEAD, Calif., October 28, 2025--Edison International (NYSE: EIX) today reported third-quarter net income of $832 million, or $2.16 per share, compared to net income of $516 million, or $1.33 per share, in the third quarter of last year. As adjusted, third-quarter core earnings were $901 million, or $2.34 per share, compared to core earnings of $582 million, or $1.51 per share, in the third quarter of last year.

As adjusted, third-quarter core earnings were $901 million, or $2.34 per share, compared to core earnings of $582 million, or $1.51 per share, in the third quarter of last year.
